website_summaries.verdict: Learning the concepts of computer coding is a popular activity in the 21st century classroom, and this Osmo add-on game introduces children and adults to these concepts in a very entertaining way.
pros: Good introduction to the concept of computer coding
Gameplay is appealing to adult users as well
Popular among students with ADHD and autism
cons: Will not work without an additional Osmo base
Some younger children may lose interest quickly

website_summaries.verdict: Intended for children as young as 4, this coding game, an add-on to the base unit’s 3 included games, is great for teaching problem solving skills.
pros: This add-on coding game for the Osmo system uses tactile blocks to teach problem solving and logic
Coding pieces snap together easily and game is very responsive
cons: Some users may initially be frustrated getting started with this game

customer_reviews.title: ... to my students and this has been such a great tool for me and an even bigger hit with ...
customer_reviews.text: I am a Kindergarten teacher and have begun to teach Computer Science to my students and this has been such a great tool for me and an even bigger hit with the kids! Even my 4 year daughter wants to play "Awbie." The students have such a great time using and arranging the blocks to interact with Awbie onscreen. Don't be afraid to get this game if you don't know anything about Coding you wont regret it!
customer_reviews.author: Matthew

customer_reviews.title: Kiddos (6 and 8) love this game
customer_reviews.text: Kiddos (6 and 8) love this game! They play all the time. Easy for them to set up and break down on their own. It makes me feel better about them being on technology when i feel like they are actually learning something rather than wasting their time on non learning games.
customer_reviews.author: Kurt

customer_reviews.title: Our 5 Year Old Loves It
customer_reviews.text: We purchased this for a fun learning activity we could add to our home school repertoire, and an engaging quiet time activity, and our 5 year old absolutely loves it. She is on the brink of reading, but not quite there yet, and is able to navigate and play this game with very little guidance. Having her hand(s) over part of the tiles when pressing the 'run' button seems to be her most frequent obstacle, for which the app doesn't offer a lot of guidance, but it's nudges for everything else seem to be spot on. I'm impressed with the design and experience they have built for this game.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Product is pretty cool. Our oldest daughter (7) loves playing with ...
customer_reviews.text: Product is pretty cool. Our oldest daughter (7) loves playing with this and picked up the concept fairly quickly. It is one of the Osmo items that she most wants to play. Easily fits into the rest of the Osmo items and works well for math and puzzles.
customer_reviews.author: Dave Roth

customer_reviews.title: Cool concept.
customer_reviews.text: This was a Christmas gift for my son and it was great, at first! It fails to read the tiles, a lot! It would freeze and we would have to restart the game. Very frustrating! My 8 year old ended up beating all the levels in 3 days. I wish they had options for difficulty or offered more levels. Maybe better for a younger child?
customer_reviews.author: Mamashopper

customer_reviews.title: Great introduction to coding, fun to play
customer_reviews.text: My 5 year old loves this. He plays it for about an hour at a time. Its a great intro to coding and the tangible pieces and the character makes it fun for my kid as he plays it and keeps him interested. You have to move the characters using codes and then collect strawberries. Later on you use your strawberries to build things in your virtual village. The longer the code the more points you get for strawberries collected. You have to collect a certain amount of strawberries to advance to the next level. Love the parent app that it shows you the stats of my kids codes.
customer_reviews.author: Theo

customer_reviews.title: like all Osmo products, pleased with purchase
customer_reviews.text: As with all the Osmo products that we have, I am pleased with this purchase. We have retained the box for storage, and the Osmo Tangram, Numbers, and Words containers stack perfectly on top of this box (2 per level). The pieces are an easy size for quick visualization and movement when playing the app, and I have found children pick up rather quickly on this game.
customer_reviews.author: CMM

customer_reviews.title: Good intro to coding - but could use slightly more instruction
customer_reviews.text: Managed to get this from Amazon as Osmo have actually discontinued it from their site. It's a great kit and makes a lot more sense than the Coding Jam kit which is their newer one. My 5 yr old took to it immediately. I do wish there was slightly more instruction on how the points work when you move through the levels. If you code more steps and collect more food in one move then your points add up faster. Overall, a great kit and get it while you can!
customer_reviews.author: tech dad

customer_reviews.title: A must to help kids with school
customer_reviews.text: These are what you want to disguise learning as fun. My kids love these and cant get enough. The game you can get for these are crafted with quality. Great problem solving games along with disguising serving pizza with math skills and keeping kids attention. My 3 and 6 year old cant get enough of these and I dont mind if they play for a while cause I know they are learning.
customer_reviews.author: Jason Wolfe

customer_reviews.title: My some LOVES it. Great problem solving
customer_reviews.text: I’m impressed with my 6 year old’s ability to use this game. If I didn’t know better, I would have rated it as 8 or 9+ but he absolutely loves it and doesn’t get stumped often. In fact, when he does, by the time I come over and try and help figure it out, he gets it before I do! Great brain game in my opinion.
customer_reviews.author: Cali_Karen

customer_reviews.title: Excellent game!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! Easy to set up, easy to use. The tutorial is built into the game so the kids didn't get board. My boyfriend is a programmer and loves this for my boys. It really does encourage the style of problem solving required for coding.
customer_reviews.author: CleverDogMom

customer_reviews.title: Great for 6 years old and younger.
customer_reviews.text: It’s a great and fun game for my 6 years old but not interesting and engaging for my 10 years old. It’s not changing much during the game and keep being easy enough through the whole game for my 6 years old.
customer_reviews.author: Michal B.

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!  Educational and Fun!
customer_reviews.text: My six yr. old granddaughter loves the Osmo coding. She figured out how to use this exceptional learning tool all by herself - no adult reading instructions. Little by little I hope to get her the whole set!

customer_reviews.title: A must for coding education
customer_reviews.text: Like every OSMO game this is very educational and tons of fun. It doesn’t underestimate your kid and makes it challenging for all ages. My 5 yo blows me away with what he does on this game. This is a must for your kid, especially if you want your kid to learn coding.

customer_reviews.title: Great educational tool
customer_reviews.text: I am a big fan of the Osmo. We got the genius kit last year for Christmas and have since added the coding music game and now this. They are fun and educational and I love that the manipulatives are real.

product_meta.title: Osmo - Coding Awbie - Ages 5-12 - Coding & Problem Solving - For iPad or Fire Tablet (Osmo Base Required)
product_meta.description:
Coding is a modern superpower with the Coding Awbie from Osmo. Coding Awbie teaches logic skills and problem solving, and it helps kids succeed in an increasingly digital world. Coding Awbie is the easiest way to introduce coding to your child. Osmo games bring a child's creative imagination to life with hand held pieces that interact with an iPad and/or Fire Tablet and an Osmo Base (No WiFi necessary for game play). Coding Awbie requires an Osmo Base to play and this game does not ship with an Osmo Base. An Osmo Base for iPad or Fire Tablet must be purchased to play Coding Awbie. Approved by parents and teachers worldwide, used in over 31, 000 classrooms.

FROM THE MANUFACTURER
feature_bullets: A newer version is available. Coding Starter Kit for iPad, Coding Starter Kit for Fire Tablet or Coding Family Bundle for iPad and Fire Tablet are available.

TEACHING: Uses hands-on physcial blocks to control Awbie, a playful character who loves delicious strawberries. Each block is a coding command that directs Awbie on a fun-filled adventure enabling coding & problem solving (Coding Awbie).

SKILLS LEARNED: Logic, coding fundamentals, basics of programming, listening, critical thinking, observation, creative problem solving & pattern recognition. Osmo sees and reacts to every real-life move. Geared towards children & love of learning.

AGE & CAPABILITY: Ages 5-12+. Game is designed for beginner to expert levels. Osmo enables the continuation of learning. Real-time audio and visual feedback lets children learn through experimentation in a stress-free environment.

COMPATIBILITY FOR IPAD & FIRE TABLET: Compatible iPads: All iPads except Generation 1, iPad Pro 11-inch and iPad Pro 12.9-inch. The minimum iOS version needed is iOS 9. Compatible Fire Tablets: 7th Generation Fire 7, 7th Generation Fire HD 8, 7th Generation Fire HD10, 8th Generation Fire HD 8, 9th Generation Fire 7, 9th Generation Fire HD 10. Currently not compatible with the new Fire HD8 launched May 2020.

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars615 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
